p:
Cyclophilin A is a newly reported uncoating regulator for EV-A71 entry, and its binding site is very close to that of PSGL1 and HS on EV-A71 virion [ 22]. The MADAL class of tryptophan dendrimers may thus have the potential to block Cyclophilin A binding. However, the Cyclophilin A inhibitor cyclosporin A (CsA) did not affect binding of EV-A71 BrCr to RD cells (
S8 Fig ) nor could we observe any antiviral activity of CsA or Debio-025 (another specific Cyclophilin A inhibitor) against BrCr and the clinical isolates 11316 and 812 (CsA EC 50>30μM and Debio-025 EC 50>21μM), suggesting that this host factor does not play a prominent role in the entry of the strains that we used in our study.
